string.description: name of the ClusterIncident
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
A short description of the Incident generator

bool.description: Indicates if the incident generator is enabled

list.description: Instances associated with this incident generator

string.description: The individual assigned to resolve the incident (references the User table).
The group responsible for addressing the incident (references the Group table).

bool.description: If true this app will automatically resolve the incident when the object is deleted.

string.description: The user who reported the incident (references the User table).
General category of the incident (e.g., Software, Hardware, Network).
A code indicating how the incident was resolved (e.g., Solved (Workaround), Solved (Permanently)).
Notes on how the incident was resolved.

The Configuration Item (CI) associated with the incident,
linking it to an asset or service in the CMDB (Configuration Management Database).
Custom field name
Custom field value, a Go template

list_nested.description: List of custom fields to add to the incident

string.description: A detailed description of the issue.

list.description:
Fields to include in the subscribe results, which can then be used in the template,
e.g. '.namespace.node.name' or '.namespace.node.srl.interface.name"'.

string.description: Impact level on the organization, usually from 1 (highest) to 3 (lowest).
Physical or logical location related to the incident.
Numeric priority of the incident, usually from 1 (highest) to 5 (lowest).
Indicates the type of resolution applied.

A Go template used to generate a brief summary of the incident
when raising it in service now.
The template can use the fields from the subscription results.
e.g. 'Interface {{.node.srl.interface.name}} is down on node {{.node.name}}'.

The current status of the incident, typically represented by codes:
  1: New
  2: In Progress
  3: On Hold
  4: Resolved
  6: Closed
More specific subcategory within the main category.
EDB table to subscribe to. e.g. '.namespace.node.srl.interface'
Urgency level, typically from 1 (highest) to 5 (lowest).
A where clause to use for the subscribe request, e.g: 'oper-state = down'. You can omit enclosing parentheses.

single_nested.description: Include a query source in this incident generator
Sources for incident generation
ClusterIncidentSpec defines the desired state of ClusterIncident
ClusterIncidentStatus defines the observed state of ClusterIncident

string.description: a comma-separated list of resource fields to fetch/return.  If unspecified, all fields are fetched.  If empty, only key-fields are fetched.
an EQL "where" expression that will be used to filter the set of resources returned.
a label selector string to filter the results based on CR labels

string.description: name of the ClusterInstance
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash

Reference to a Kubernetes secret containing client credentials
Secret. It must includes the keys: `client_id`, `client_secret`,
`username` and `password`.

int64.description: Number of retries for API requests. Defaults to 0 i.e no retries.

string.description: Interval between retries in case of a failed request
Timeout for API requests to ServiceNow
The URL of the ServiceNow instance
API version to use when connecting to ServiceNow

single_nested.description: ClusterInstanceSpec defines the desired state of ClusterInstance

string.description: Provides an error reason if the instance is unreachable
Last checked time for connectivity status

bool.description: Indicates if the ServiceNow instance is reachable

single_nested.description: InstanceStatus defines the observed state of Instance

an EQL "where" expression that will be used to filter the set of resources returned.
a label selector string to filter the results based on CR labels
